articles.title: Collector saved rare Robert Burns book after barber used it to clean razors - The Telegraph
articles.description: John Murison stepped in when he spotted the first edition of Poems Chiefly In The Scottish Dialect lying in a decrepit state in the shop
articles.content:
A 19th century collector of Robert Burns memorabilia stopped a barber from tearing out the pages of one of the poets rarest works to clean his razors, it emerged on Monday.

articles.description: A video of a King's Guard 'staring at a duck' while on duty has been shared on social media. The clip appears to show a guard of the Royal Family loitering at Windsor Castle.
